items.title: JPA not saving foreign key to @OneToMany relation
items.body:
I'm using Spring with Hibernate as a JPA provider and are trying to get a @OneToMany (a contact having many phonenumbers) to save the foreign key in the phone numbers table. From my form i get a Contact object that have a list of Phone(numbers) in it. The Contact get persisted properly (Hibernate fetches an PK from the specified sequence). The list of Phone(numbers) also gets persisted with a correct PK, but there's no FK to the Contacts table. 

public class Contact implements Serializable {
@OneToMany(mappedBy = "contactId", cascade = CascadeType.ALL, fetch=FetchType.EAGER)
private List<Phone> phoneList;
}

public class Phone implements Serializable {
@JoinColumn(name = "contact_id", referencedColumnName = "contact_id")
@ManyToOne
private Contact contactId;
}

@Repository("contactDao")
@Transactional(readOnly = true)
public class ContactDaoImpl implements ContactDao {
    @Transactional(readOnly = false, propagation = Propagation.REQUIRES_NEW)
    public void save(Contact c) {
    em.persist(c);
    em.flush();
    }
}


@Controller
public class ContactController {
    @RequestMapping(value = "/contact/new", method = RequestMethod.POST)
    public ModelAndView newContact(Contact c) {
    ModelAndView mv = new ModelAndView("contactForm");
    contactDao.save(c);
    mv.addObject("contact", c);
    return mv;
    }
}

Hopefully I got all of the relevant bits above, otherwise please let me know.

items.title: How to correctly implement Google Authenticator
items.body:
How to correctly implement Google Authenticator

I am trying to wrap my head around Google Authenticator implementation. I want to be able to replicate the iPhone google authenticator app, in other words I want my own app that spits out my gmail verification codes the same way that my iPhone app does it. I tried out this library that I can’t make it to work or there could be something I was doing incorrectly. https://github.com/PHPGangsta/GoogleAuthenticator

Here are the steps I’ve taken:

1 - Went to accounts.google.com and scanned my barcode using my iPhone
2 - Saved the secret key
3 - And using the PHPGangsta library, generate 6 digit code with secret key 
4 - Use code to sign in to my google account
5 - Sign in Failed 
6 - Me sad

Here is my code:

<?php
require_once 'GoogleAuthenticator.php';

$ga = new PHPGangsta_GoogleAuthenticator();

$secret = 'mysecretkey1209312310293';

echo "Secret is: ".$secret."\n\n";

//not sure if this qrCodeUrl thing matters
$qrCodeUrl = $ga->getQRCodeGoogleUrl('my@google.com', $secret); 

echo "Google Charts URL for the QR-Code: ".$qrCodeUrl."\n\n";

$oneCode = $ga->getCode($secret);

echo "Checking Code '$oneCode' and Secret '$secret':\n";

$checkResult = $ga->verifyCode($secret, $oneCode, 2);    // 2 = 2*30sec clock tolerance
if ($checkResult) {
    echo 'OK';
} else {
    echo 'FAILED';
}

items.body_markdown:
It seems that Xcode 9.3 does fix [one issue I was having](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/48814508/are-implicitly-unwrapped-optionals-truly-optionals/48815104#48815104), but in Swift 4.1 the second half of this code still doesn't compile:

    var obj: SomeClass!    ; class SomeClass {}
    
    func inoutFunc(_: inout SomeClass?) {}
    inoutFunc(&obj)     // works
    
    func pointerFunc(_: UnsafeMutablePointer<SomeClass?>) {}
    pointerFunc(&obj)  // <-- COMPILER ERROR

The call to `inoutFunc` is now fine, but the call to `pointerFunc` still gives me an error:

> Cannot invoke 'pointerFunc' with an argument list of type '(inout SomeClass!)'

Or in the original context:

> Cannot pass immutable value of type 'ActualClass?' as inout argument

Similar to my Swift 4.0 issue (where the `inoutFunc` didn't compile either) if I change the declaration to `var obj: SomeClass?` then the second function call compiles without complaint.

Is this another lingering Swift bug related to Implicitly Unwrapped Optionals, or would this `UnsafeMutablePointer` situation not be expected to work like the `inout` version now does? Is there a relatively clean workaround?


---

Background:

In the actual code, the `pointerFunc` call is an Apple framework function which either initializes the instance or returns an error status.

Since I already `guard AppleFrameworkInitializer(&obj) == noErr else { /* … */ }`, I don't want to deal with re-assigning from a temporary optional, or have to constantly unwrap `obj!` in all the code that follows.

That is, this seems like a legitimate use case for Implicitly Unwrapped Optionals and I'm wondering why I still can't use one here.
items.title: Why can't I pass an implicitly unwrapped optional as an UnsafeMutablePointer?
items.body:
It seems that Xcode 9.3 does fix one issue I was having, but in Swift 4.1 the second half of this code still doesn't compile:

var obj: SomeClass!    ; class SomeClass {}

func inoutFunc(_: inout SomeClass?) {}
inoutFunc(&obj)     // works

func pointerFunc(_: UnsafeMutablePointer<SomeClass?>) {}
pointerFunc(&obj)  // <-- COMPILER ERROR

The call to inoutFunc is now fine, but the call to pointerFunc still gives me an error:

Cannot invoke 'pointerFunc' with an argument list of type '(inout SomeClass!)'

Or in the original context:

Cannot pass immutable value of type 'ActualClass?' as inout argument

Similar to my Swift 4.0 issue (where the inoutFunc didn't compile either) if I change the declaration to var obj: SomeClass? then the second function call compiles without complaint.

Is this another lingering Swift bug related to Implicitly Unwrapped Optionals, or would this UnsafeMutablePointer situation not be expected to work like the inout version now does? Is there a relatively clean workaround?

Background:

In the actual code, the pointerFunc call is an Apple framework function which either initializes the instance or returns an error status.

Since I already guard AppleFrameworkInitializer(&obj) == noErr else { /* … */ }, I don't want to deal with re-assigning from a temporary optional, or have to constantly unwrap obj! in all the code that follows.

That is, this seems like a legitimate use case for Implicitly Unwrapped Optionals and I'm wondering why I still can't use one here.

items.title: show/hide a div on hover and hover out
items.body:
I would like to show and hide a div during hover and hover out.

here's what I've done lately.

css

.flyout {
    position: absolute;
    width: 1000px;
    height: 450px;
    background: red;
    overflow: hidden;
    z-index: 10000;
}

.hidden {
    visibility: hidden;
}

html

<div id="menu" class="margint10 round-border">
                <a href="#"><img src="images/menu.jpg" alt="" id="menu_link"/></a>
            </div>
<div class="flyout hidden"> </div>

javascript/jquery

$("#menu").hover(function(){
    $('.flyout').removeClass('hidden');
},function(){
    $('.flyout').addClass('hidden');
});

My problem is that when I hover on the menu id, the flyout div is blinking. why is that?

items.title: How do you set an exclusive value for media queries?
items.body:
@media only screen and (min-width: 768px) {
    /* stuff to do when the screen is >= 768px */
}

But what I need is to set a value when the screen is at maximum, 767.9999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999px.

Because Bootstrap does their breakpoints mobile first I am having to redefine some css.

 .red-when-small-green-when-not-small {
    color:red;
}
@media only screen and (min-width: 768px) {
    .red-when-small-green-when-not-small {
        color: green;
    }
}

Meanwhile, that it should be green is already defined.

master.css:

.red-when-small-green-when-not-small {
    color: green;
}

You see what I'm saying? I end up having to say that I want it green twice in order to avoid that 1px zone where the min-max media queries don't match up.

items.body_markdown:
I am using the Data Model option, in Excel 2016, to create a distinct count on a pivot. The table includes loan numbers and the reason the loan is on the report. The loan number can show up for several different reasons, therefore, the loan number can be on the report several times. The pivot helps me see if the loan shows up more than once for the same reason with a count. 

When I double click a number in the pivot that uses the distinct count all the columns in the new tab say (Table1)Loan Number, (Table1)Reason, etc. The bigger issues is that the columns are in alphabetical order rather than the order I originally have set up on my table. Does anyone know how to keep the original table formatting?
items.title: Excel 2016 Distinct Count column ordering
items.body:

The loan number can show up for several different reasons, therefore, the loan number can be on the report several times. The pivot helps me see if the loan shows up more than once for the same reason with a count.

When I double click a number in the pivot that uses the distinct count all the columns in the new tab say (Table1)Loan Number, (Table1)Reason, etc. The bigger issues is that the columns are in alphabetical order rather than the order I originally have set up on my table. Does anyone know how to keep the original table formatting?

items.title: Use javascript to allow multiple highlights by users
items.body:
I am trying to allow students reading a webpage to highlight multiple areas of text. I have some javascript that sort of works. On a mouseup event, it adds a span around the selected text, but it throws a DOMException when the selection crosses another tag (e.g., paragraph) because you end up with improperly nested tags. See:

https://jsfiddle.net/pinecone/or6tjasg/

Any suggestions on how I might approach this? Thanks for your help.

    document.getElementById('highlight-area').addEventListener("mouseup", function(event) {
  highlightSelection();
});

function highlightSelection() {

  if (window.getSelection) {
    var sel = window.getSelection();
    if (sel.rangeCount) {
      var range = sel.getRangeAt(0).cloneRange();
      var extracContents = range.cloneContents();
      if (extracContents.childNodes.length === 1) {
        range.deleteContents();
        var span = document.createElement("span");
        span.className = "highlight";
        span.appendChild(extracContents);
        range.insertNode(span);
        sel.removeAllRanges();
        sel.addRange(range);
      }
    }
  }
}

items.title: Saving an image with JQuery?
items.body:
I have page where users can upload a photo to the browser with jQuery but I am now trying to figure how to actually save the photo by sending it to a php script. I understand the php side but don't know how with Jquery to send the photo to php. Do I need to put the input within a form?

jQuery

$(document).ready(function() {
    var readURL = function(input) {
        if (input.files && input.files[0]) {
            var reader = new FileReader();

            reader.onload = function (e) {
                $('.profile-pic').attr('src', e.target.result);
            }

            reader.readAsDataURL(input.files[0]);
        }
    }

    $(".file-upload").on('change', function(){
        readURL(this);
    });

    $(".upload-button").on('click', function() {
        $(".file-upload").click();
    });
});

HTML

<div class="container">
    <div class="row">
        <div class="col-xs-6 test">
            <h1> Upload Profile Image </h1>

            <div class="circle">
                <!-- User Profile Image -->
                <img class="profile-pic" src="https://source.unsplash.com/300x300">
            </div>
            <div class="p-image">
                <i class="fa fa-camera upload-button"></i>
                <form>
                    <input class="file-upload" id="userImage" type="file" accept="image/*"/>
                </form>
            </div>
        </div>
    </div>
</div>

items.title: flow type React ref callback and createRef
items.body:
class Component extends React.Component<ComponentProps> {
  // ...magic
  elementRef = React.createRef();

  render() {
    return this.props.children(this.elementRef);
  }
}

This is a component I have. Its basically passing the ref callback to children. and then its used like this

<Component>
  {elementRef => (
    <div ref={elementRef} />
  )}
</Component>

The intention of my Component is that the children can attach the elementRef to any element.

But I having a lot of trouble type my component correctly.

What I am doing right now:

type ComponentProps = {
  +children: (
    ref: { current: HTMLDivElement | null } | ((ref: ?HTMLDivElement) => void)
  ) => React.Node,
};

But obviously this only works for div. If I were to use the elementRef on a span. Flow would complain.

So how should I type my Component correctly so that it works for any HTML element?

items.body_markdown:
I have a Ruby On Rails app deployed on Heroku, Im using the ElasticSearch add-on, my elastic search clusters were working normally but recently ElasticSearch add-on required all clusters to enforce authentication to protect the data that is inside of the hosted cluster, now on every request we try to make we receive the following exception:

```
Tire::Search::SearchRequestFailed (401 : {"error":{"root_cause":[{"type":"security_exception","reason":"action [indices:data/read/search] requires authentication","header":{"WWW-Authenticate":"Basic realm=\"shield\" charset=\"UTF-8\""}}],"type":"security_exception","reason":"action [indices:data/read/search] requires authentication","header":{"WWW-Authenticate":"Basic realm=\"shield\" charset=\"UTF-8\""}},"status":401}):
```

We configured some users from the [Shield][1] plugin that comes with Elasticsearch, however Im not sure how can I enter this authentication from my ruby On Rails application, Im using Tire to integrate elastic search in my Ruby On Rails app, but I can't find were can I put this information in order to authenticate my app and solve this issue.

We would like to know how to authenticate using these two gems:
[ElasticSearch-rails][2] and [Tire][3]


  [1]: https://www.elastic.co/products/x-pack/security
  [2]: https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch-rails
  [3]: https://github.com/karmi/retire
items.title: Ruby On Rails: ElasticSearch authentication (Tire and ElasticSearch-rails)
items.body:
I have a Ruby On Rails app deployed on Heroku, Im using the ElasticSearch add-on, my elastic search clusters were working normally but recently ElasticSearch add-on required all clusters to enforce authentication to protect the data that is inside of the hosted cluster, now on every request we try to make we receive the following exception:

Tire::Search::SearchRequestFailed (401 : {"error":{"root_cause":[{"type":"security_exception","reason":"action [indices:data/read/search] requires authentication","header":{"WWW-Authenticate":"Basic realm=\"shield\" charset=\"UTF-8\""}}],"type":"security_exception","reason":"action [indices:data/read/search] requires authentication","header":{"WWW-Authenticate":"Basic realm=\"shield\" charset=\"UTF-8\""}},"status":401}):

We configured some users from the Shield plugin that comes with Elasticsearch, however Im not sure how can I enter this authentication from my ruby On Rails application, Im using Tire to integrate elastic search in my Ruby On Rails app, but I can't find were can I put this information in order to authenticate my app and solve this issue.

We would like to know how to authenticate using these two gems: ElasticSearch-rails and Tire

items.title: Spark Standalone - Tmp Folder
items.body:
I'm working with Jupyter Notebook with Pyspark kernel on a node of a cluster, the problem is that my /tmp folder is always full. I already updated the parameters:

SPARK_WORKER_OPTS="-Dspark.worker.cleanup.enabled=true -Dspark.worker.cleanup.appDataTtl=172800"

The problem is that the folder has just 200GB, is there a way to say to spark clean when I shutdown the kernel in Jupyter? Or should I just set Dspark.worker.cleanup.appDataTtl to 30 min, so that every 30 min all the temp files/logs are deleted?

items.body_markdown:
I have this regular expression, it's able to find everything inside square brackets ignoring the ones containing comma and other square brackets inside.

However is not finished, what I'm trying to achieve now, is to find only the ones that contains at least one '=' symbol inside the  square brackets, if not, I'm not interested.


Current regex: 

    \[([^,\[\]]+?)\]

Input examples:

 - [Test=Test] -> Match: [Test=Test] and it's ok
 - [Test=Test;Test2=Test2] -> Match: [Test=Test;Test2=Test2] and it's ok
 - [Test,Test] -> No match and it's ok
 - [T[E]ST] -> Match: [E] and it's not ok (equal symbol is missing)
 - [T[E=S]T] -> Match: [E=S] and it's ok

Not sure if I'm in the correct direction because I'm already getting everything inside 2 characteres when some characteres are not inside.. but how to tell to do it only when a specific character is there..?

I hope someone can give me a hand, this regex is driving me crazy

Thanks
items.title: Regex C#, get everything between 2 characters but only when a specific character is in between and some others are missing
items.body:
I have this regular expression, it's able to find everything inside square brackets ignoring the ones containing comma and other square brackets inside.

However is not finished, what I'm trying to achieve now, is to find only the ones that contains at least one '=' symbol inside the square brackets, if not, I'm not interested.

Current regex: 

\[([^,\[\]]+?)\]

Input examples:

  • [Test=Test] -> Match: [Test=Test] and it's ok
  • [Test=Test;Test2=Test2] -> Match: [Test=Test;Test2=Test2] and it's ok
  • [Test,Test] -> No match and it's ok
  • [T[E]ST] -> Match: [E] and it's not ok (equal symbol is missing)
  • [T[E=S]T] -> Match: [E=S] and it's ok

Not sure if I'm in the correct direction because I'm already getting everything inside 2 characteres when some characteres are not inside.. but how to tell to do it only when a specific character is there..?

I hope someone can give me a hand, this regex is driving me crazy

Thanks

items.body_markdown:
In my work I need to create MS Word documents using VBA in Matlab.
Currently I am facing an error when trying to set the font color in MS Word 365.  
  
For MS Word versions 2007 and earlier I use the command  

        color_RGB = R + 256 * G + 256 * 256 * B;  
        doc_serv.Selection.Font.Color = color_RGB;

While for all MS Word versions after 2007 I am using the command

        doc_serv.Selection.Font.TextColor.RGB = color_RGB;

The error message is:

        Error: Not implemented

The latter command is reporting an error when applied to MS Word 365.
Is there any new command for setting the font color again, or am I doing something wrong from the beginning?
  
Thanks in advance!
items.title: Any new VBA command for font color in MS Word 365?
items.body:
In my work I need to create MS Word documents using VBA in Matlab. Currently I am facing an error when trying to set the font color in MS Word 365.

For MS Word versions 2007 and earlier I use the command 

    color_RGB = R + 256 * G + 256 * 256 * B;  
    doc_serv.Selection.Font.Color = color_RGB;

While for all MS Word versions after 2007 I am using the command

    doc_serv.Selection.Font.TextColor.RGB = color_RGB;

The error message is:

    Error: Not implemented

The latter command is reporting an error when applied to MS Word 365. Is there any new command for setting the font color again, or am I doing something wrong from the beginning?

Thanks in advance!

items.title: Odoo 10 actions: pre-fill a form
items.body:
Here's my issue. For now I've

    <record id="purchase_requisition_line_view" model="ir.ui.view">
            <field name="name">Purchase requisition line view</field>
            <field name="model">purchase.requisition.line</field>


            <field name="arch" type="xml">
                <tree string="Articles list">
                    <field name="product_id"/>
                    <field name="requested_by_employee"/>
                    <field name="product_qty"/>
                    <field name="stock_qty"/>
                    <field name="qty_ordered"/>
                    <field groups="product.group_uom" name="product_uom_id"/>
                    <field name="date_required"/>
                    <field name="seller"/>
                    <field name="requisition_id"/>
                    <field name="is_urgency"/>
                </tree>
            </field>
        </record>

        <record id="action_purchase_requisitionline" model="ir.actions.act_window">
            <field name="name">Purchase request list</field>
            <field name="type">ir.actions.act_window</field>
            <field name="res_model">purchase.requisition.line</field>
            <field name="view_type">form</field>
            <field name="view_mode">tree,form</field>
        </record>
<record id="action_select_s_to_order" model="ir.actions.server">
            <field name="name">Do a barrel roll</field>
            <field name="context">{"default_requisition_id":active_id}</field>
            <field name="model_id" ref="purchase.model_purchase_order"/>
            <field name="code">
                // what
            </field>

        </record>

        <record model="ir.values" id="ir_values_create_order_button">
            <field name="model_id" ref="purchase.model_purchase_order_line" />
            <field name="name">Create Order</field>
            <field name="key2">client_action_multi</field>
            <field name="value" eval="'ir.actions.server,' + str(ref('action_select_s_to_order'))" />
            <field name="key">action</field>
            <field name="model">purchase.requisition.line</field>
        </record>

        <menuitem action="action_purchase_requisitionline" id="purchase_requisition.menu_purchase_requisition_line" name="Purchase Requisition Articles" parent="purchase.menu_procurement_management" sequence="11"/>

I've been working all day on a server action menu. Basically I want when I select Purchase Requests (I have a custom view with all the PR listed by items) creating a new pre-fill quotation with the item requested ... How can I do that ?

items.title: Searching dataset by multiple tags
items.body:
Maybe the title of this question is a little bit odd because I simply have no idea what I'm looking for.

I have some data e.g. a string and multiple tags associated with it. Now I would like to have the ability to search through my data with a string.

Edit: The Problem is not the string comparison or the substring search! The Problem is the connection from the result to the data object.

Here a Movie example:

"Title1" tags: "genre1" "genre2" "actor1" "actor2"
"Title2" tags: "genre2" "actor2" "actor3"
"Title3" tags: "genre2" "genre3" "actor1" "actor3"

Search for "genre2" -> "Title1", "Title2", "Title3"
Search for "Title1" -> "Title1"
Serach for "actor1" -> "Title1", "Title3"

Other examples:

  • YouTube: Search for a Video ...
  • Amazon: Search for "tv" but "tv" does not have to be in the title.

The only thing in my mind is a multimap pointing to a list of all possibilities. Then I have to compare the search string with all keys and tada. But I can not believe that this is a good solution because I would have an insane amount of lists...

Can anyone give me an idea of what I'm looking for and maybe how I can implement this? I use c++ with Qt. I don't know if Qt could help me in any way.

Edit: I could add all keyword together like this:

"Title1 genre1 genre2 actor1 actor2"
"Title2 genre2 actor2 actor3"
"Title3 genre2 genre3 actor1 actor3"

Create a map with this key to the data object. Then I only have to do a string search and get all strings where the search string is a substring of the key.

But is this a good solution? What if I want to prioritize a match in the title?

items.body_markdown:
I am trying to make on component layout override or a custom menu item  on Joomla 3.7.2 but I can not make it work.

I followed the instructions from the documentation https://docs.joomla.org/Layout_Overrides_in_Joomla
and I placed “myarticle.php” in the folder 
JPATH_ROOT/templates/beez3/html/com_content/article resulting in the following structure for my files:

    JPATH_ROOT/templates/beez3/html/com_content/article/default.php
    JPATH_ROOT/templates/beez3/html/com_content/article/default_links.php
    JPATH_ROOT/templates/beez3/html/com_content/article/myarticle.php
(defaut.php and default.php are template overrides files placed by the templates itself).

I expected to see the “myarticle” option at the drop down selection for layouts either on global article options or the article options itself. It did not show up.

The I tried to make a menu item override and according to the same documentation I added one more file “myarticle.xml” resulting to the following structure:

    JPATH_ROOT/templates/beez3/html/com_content/article/default.php 
    JPATH_ROOT/templates/beez3/html/com_content/article/default_links.php
    JPATH_ROOT/templates/beez3/html/com_content/article/myarticle.php
    JPATH_ROOT/templates/beez3/html/com_content/article/myarticle.xml

I expected to see “myarticle” menu item type under “Article” menu types when I tried to ad a new menu  item, but nothing new appeared.


am using this set up:
Joomla 3.7.2, php7.0.9, apache 2.4.23, mariadb 10.1.16.

I don't believe that extensions I have installed on joomla are causing the problem because I am testing it on new article with beez3 template.

But to give you the full picture, the extensions I have installed are:
Chrono Forms5, Contact Map, Phoca Gallery.

I have also installed JD New York Template which is using Gantry 4.23 framework.



Can someone help me?

Thanks in advance Christoforos

items.title: Rails skip over/ignore data for links?
items.body:
So I am setting up previous post links in my Rails app and have the following in my show:

<% if @post.previous.blog_key == 'blog' && @post.previous.visible == true %>
 <%= link_to 'previous post', blog_post_path(@post.previous.url_name%>
<% else %>
 <%= link_to 'Home', '/blog/home' %>
<% end %>

Then in my model I have:

def previous
 SpudPost.where(["published_at < ?", published_at]).last
end

def next
 SpudPost.where(["published_at > ?", published_at]).first
end

What I'm trying to do is only have the previous links to go to those blog posts that are marked as having a blog_key that says blog AND marked to be visible. If it's not blog/false then ignore it and go to the next one that says blog and visible.

The problem is that it doesn't go to the next one that says blog/true. If the next one says blog_key == 'news' then it applies to 'Home'. Should it just be another filter within the previous/next methods instead?

items.title: What would be more efficient? (Resizing, moving, snapping etc. ) - JavaFX
items.body:
Let me give you a scenario:
You want to create an application using stage.UNDECORATED, however you still want all the functionalities (possibly more). To do this I found 2 approaches:

  1. You create a fxml file with multiple panes on the sides. (kinda like this: https://github.com/goxr3plus/FX-BorderlessScene/blob/master/resources/fxml/Borderless.fxml). This allows you to control each side based on the location of those panes.
  2. You calculate the boundaries and use no extra panes.

I've been told that using calculations is a better way to do it, however I have my doubts. When using option 1 you don't need to continuously perform checks.

Let me use some code to clarify: 

private Direction checkBound(double x, double y, double minX, double minY, double maxY, double maxX) {
        if (x >= minX && x <= (minX + bound) && y >= minY && y <= (minY + bound)) {
            // Left Top
            return Direction.NW;
        }
        else if (x >= minX && x <= (minX + bound) && y <= maxY && y >= (maxY - bound)) {
            // Left Bottom
            return Direction.SW;
        }
        else if (x <= maxX && x >= (maxX - bound) && y >= minY && y <= (minY + bound)) {
            // Right Top
            return Direction.NE;
        }
        else if (x <= maxX && x >= (maxX - bound) && y <= maxY && y >= (maxY - bound)) {
            // Right Bottom
            return Direction.SE;
        }
        else if (x >= minX && x <= (minX + bound) && y >= minY && y <= maxY) {
            // left
            return Direction.W;
        }
        else if (x <= maxX && x >= (maxX - bound) && y >= minY && y <= maxY) {
            // right
            return Direction.E;
        }
        else if (x >= minX && x <= maxX && y >= minY && y <= (minY + bound)) {
            // top & BOTTOM
            return Direction.N;
        }
        else if (x >= minX && x <= maxX && y <= maxY && y >= (maxY - bound)) {
            return Direction.S;
        }

        return null;
    }

This peace of code's purpose is to determine where the mouse is located based on a node, stage or screen. So this code is running almost all the time. In my case it runs when:

1.setOnMouseReleased from the headerMenu. (aeroSnap(event); has a refrence to the check)

// this event is activated when you release the mouse from headerMenu
        headerMenu.setOnMouseReleased((MouseEvent event) -> {
            // check if the headerMenu has moved
            if (!headerMenuBounds.equals(headerMenu.localToScreen(headerMenu.getBoundsInLocal()))) {
                headerMenuBounds = headerMenu.localToScreen(headerMenu.getBoundsInLocal());
                // if it did move then we need to check if the stage should be snapped to a area
                aeroSnap(event);
            }

            transparentStage.close();
            event.consume();
        });

2. setOnMouseMoved It is used in this event, so we can change the cursor when it reaches the border of the stage

rootMenu.setOnMouseMoved((MouseEvent event) -> {
            System.out.println(stage.getY() + " : " + event.getY() + " : " + dy);
            if (!maximized) {
                Direction direction = checkBoundStage(event.getScreenX(), event.getScreenY(), stage);
                if (direction != null) {
                    switch (direction) {
                        case N:
                            stage.getScene().setCursor(Cursor.S_RESIZE);
                            resize = true;
                            break;
                        case S:
                            stage.getScene().setCursor(Cursor.N_RESIZE);
                            resize = true;
                            break;
                        case E:
                            stage.getScene().setCursor(Cursor.E_RESIZE);
                            resize = true;
                            break;
                        case W:
                            stage.getScene().setCursor(Cursor.W_RESIZE);
                            resize = true;
                            break;
                        case NE:
                            stage.getScene().setCursor(Cursor.NE_RESIZE);
                            resize = true;
                            break;
                        case NW:
                            stage.getScene().setCursor(Cursor.NW_RESIZE);
                            resize = true;
                            break;
                        case SE:
                            stage.getScene().setCursor(Cursor.SE_RESIZE);
                            resize = true;
                            break;
                        case SW:
                            stage.getScene().setCursor(Cursor.SW_RESIZE);
                            resize = true;
                            break;
                        default:
                            stage.getScene().setCursor(Cursor.DEFAULT);
                            resize = false;
                            break;
                    }
                    resizeDirection = direction;
                }
                else {
                    stage.getScene().setCursor(Cursor.DEFAULT);
                    resize = false;
                }
            }
            else {
                stage.getScene().setCursor(Cursor.DEFAULT);
                resize = false;
            }

            dx = stage.getWidth() - event.getX();
            dy = stage.getHeight() - event.getY();
        });

3.setOnMouseDragged and this one to resize the stage

rootMenu.setOnMouseDragged((MouseEvent event) -> {
            if (resize) {
                double preValue;
                switch (resizeDirection) {
                    case N:
                        preValue = stage.getY();
                        stage.setY(event.getScreenY());
                        preValue = preValue - stage.getY();
                        if (stage.getHeight() + preValue > globals.getMinHeight()) {
                            stage.setHeight(stage.getHeight() + preValue);
                        }
                        else {
                            stage.setY(preValue + stage.getY());
                        }
                        break;
                    case S:
                        if (event.getY() + dy > globals.getMinHeight()) {
                            stage.setHeight(event.getY() + dy);
                        }
                        break;
                    case W:
                        preValue = stage.getX();
                        stage.setX(event.getScreenX());
                        preValue = preValue - stage.getX();
                        if (stage.getWidth() + preValue > globals.getMinWidth()) {
                            stage.setWidth(stage.getWidth() + preValue);
                        }
                        else {
                            stage.setX(preValue + stage.getX());
                        }
                        break;
                    case E:
                        if (event.getX() + dx > globals.getMinWidth()) {
                            stage.setWidth(event.getX() + dx);
                        }
                        break;
                    case NE:
                        if (event.getX() + dx > globals.getMinWidth()) {
                            stage.setWidth(event.getX() + dx);
                        }

                        preValue = stage.getY();
                        stage.setY(event.getScreenY());
                        preValue = preValue - stage.getY();
                        if (stage.getHeight() + preValue > globals.getMinHeight()) {
                            stage.setHeight(stage.getHeight() + preValue);
                        }
                        else {
                            stage.setY(preValue + stage.getY());
                        }
                        break;
                    case NW:
                        preValue = stage.getX();
                        stage.setX(event.getScreenX());
                        preValue = preValue - stage.getX();
                        if (stage.getWidth() + preValue > globals.getMinWidth()) {
                            stage.setWidth(stage.getWidth() + preValue);
                        }
                        else {
                            stage.setX(preValue + stage.getX());
                        }
                        preValue = stage.getY();
                        stage.setY(event.getScreenY());
                        preValue = preValue - stage.getY();
                        if (stage.getHeight() + preValue > globals.getMinHeight()) {
                            stage.setHeight(stage.getHeight() + preValue);
                        }
                        else {
                            stage.setY(preValue + stage.getY());
                        }
                        break;
                    case SE:
                        if (event.getX() + dx > globals.getMinWidth()) {
                            stage.setWidth(event.getX() + dx);
                        }
                        if (event.getY() + dy > globals.getMinHeight()) {
                            stage.setHeight(event.getY() + dy);
                        }
                        break;
                    case SW:
                        preValue = stage.getX();
                        stage.setX(event.getScreenX());
                        preValue = preValue - stage.getX();
                        if (stage.getWidth() + preValue > globals.getMinWidth()) {
                            stage.setWidth(stage.getWidth() + preValue);
                        }
                        else {
                            stage.setX(preValue + stage.getX());
                        }
                        if (event.getY() + dy > globals.getMinHeight()) {
                            stage.setHeight(event.getY() + dy);
                        }
                        break;
                }

            }
            event.consume();
        });

So basically it runs almost all the time. So what approach is better? Calculations or extra panes? How do you think companies handle these kind of situations?

items.title: ASP.NET MVC Core 2.0 Cookie Authentication Fails with HttpPost ValidateAntiForgeryToken
items.body:
When I post a form to an HttpPost controller method that has the "Authorize" attribute, it fails and I get a bad request. If I remove the "ValidateAntiForgeryToken" attribute from the method, it works fine! Is this normal behavior?

My Startup:

        public void ConfigureServices(IServiceCollection services)
    {
        try
        {
            services.AddAuthentication(CookieAuthenticationDefaults.AuthenticationScheme)
                .AddCookie(CookieAuthenticationDefaults.AuthenticationScheme, options =>
                {
                    options.ExpireTimeSpan = new TimeSpan(90, 0, 0, 0);
                    options.LoginPath = new PathString("/Home/Index/");
                    options.AccessDeniedPath = new PathString("/Home/Index/");
                    options.LogoutPath = new PathString("/Home/Index/");
                    options.Validate();
                });

            services.AddMvc();
            services.AddAntiforgery();
            services.Configure<MvcOptions>(options =>
            {
                options.Filters.Add(new RequireHttpsAttribute());
            });
        }
        catch (Exception ex)
        {
            gFunc.ProcessError(ex);
        }
    }

Controller SignIn:

        // create claims
        var claims = new List<Claim>
        {
            new Claim(ClaimTypes.Name, c_signed_in.FirstName + gFunc.SPACE + c_signed_in.FamilyName),
            new Claim(ClaimTypes.Email, c_signed_in.Email),
            // new Claim(ClaimTypes.SerialNumber, c_signed_in.AccountPassword)
        };

        // create identity
        var identity = new ClaimsIdentity(claims, CookieAuthenticationDefaults.AuthenticationScheme); // cookie or local

        // create principal
        ClaimsPrincipal principal = new ClaimsPrincipal(new ClaimsIdentity(claims, CookieAuthenticationDefaults.AuthenticationScheme));

        // sign-in
        await HttpContext.SignInAsync(scheme: CookieAuthenticationDefaults.AuthenticationScheme, principal: principal);

My Controller:

    [HttpPost]        
    [Authorize]
    [ValidateAntiForgeryToken]

My View:

    <form class="form-group" asp-controller="Home" asp-action="SubmitAccountForm" enctype="multipart/form-data" method="post">

    @Html.AntiForgeryToken()

    @*code here*@

    <div class="text-center">
        <button class="btn btn-primary" type="submit">Submit</button>
    </div>

</form>
